alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued December 27 at 1:41PM PST until January 01 at 2:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THURSDAY TO 2 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously large breaking waves of 8-12 feet with sets up to 15 feet * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...From 8 AM Thursday to 2 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highest sets are expected to be tonight into Thursday, and again Friday night into Saturday. High tides at La Jolla: Thursday 5.9 feet at 904 AM. Friday: 5.7 feet at 939 AM. Saturday: 5.3 feet at 1014 AM. Sunday: 4.9 feet at 1051 AM.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure.
